Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
This class contains methods to create, store, and update food item records. Validates user input. Ensures the inventory does not go past max capacity

  • Field Summary

    Field

    A counter for the number of FoodItem records in inventory

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • alreadyExists

      public int alreadyExists(FoodItem newItem)
      Checks whether or not a FoodItem record already exists in the inventory.
      Parameters:
      newItem - A FoodItem object to be potentially added to the inventory
      Returns:
      the index of the item if it already exists in inventory. Return -1 if the food item does not exist in inventory.

    • addItem

      public boolean addItem(Scanner scanner, boolean fromFile) throws FileNotFoundException
      Prompts the user to pick what type of FoodItem to add to inventory. Loop until the user picks a valid item type. Prompts the user to enter a new item code. Loop until the user enters a new, unique, and valid code. Prompts the user to fill in the rest of the item data member fields. Adds the newly created item record to the inventory.
      Parameters:
      scanner - A scanner object used to read in user input.
      fromFile - Indicates whether or not the scanner is reading from a file.
      Returns:
      true if an item was successfully added to the inventory, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If a user enters a file name that does not exist.

    • updateQuantity

      public boolean updateQuantity(Scanner scanner, boolean buyOrSell)
      Prompts the user the enter a valid item code. Prompts the user to enter the quantity they want to buy/sell Add or subtract from the quantity of an item based on: code, quantity and buy/sell flag.
      Parameters:
      scanner - A scanner object to be used for user input.
      buyOrSell - Indicates whether the method will be used to buy or sell items. True indicates buying; false indicates selling.
      Returns:
      true if a quantity was successfully updated. Return false otherwise.

    • searchForItem

      public void searchForItem(Scanner scanner)
      Prompts the user to input an item code. Uses binary search on the inventory to find a matching item code. Displays the item record if found.
      Parameters:
      scanner - A scanner object used to read user input.

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile(Scanner scanner) throws IOException
      Prompts the user to enter a file name to create a new file. Copies the food item records into this new file.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner object used to read user input.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while writing to a file.

    • readFromFile

      public void readFromFile(Scanner scanner) throws FileNotFoundException
      Prompts the user to enter a file name to read from. Copies the food item records from the file into the inventory. If a duplicate item code is encountered in the file, stop reading.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner object used to read user input.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the user inputs a file name that does not exist.
